pullRequest.body:
Description:
Proves that the monoidal product of the Giry monoidal monad is measurable, following Lemma 4.1 https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aim.2020.107239

The file ``MeasureTheory/Measure/Prod.lean`` proves that partial applications of ``Prod.mk`` are measurable (eg. ``Measurable.map_prod_mk_left``) but this does not suffice to show that ``Prod.mk`` is a measurable function out of both arguments at once. 

Therefore, this lemma is useful for doing monadic probability theory without using Markov kernels. 

I'm a first-time contributor, so feedback is very welcome :) 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f591ce824e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22062/commits/f591ce824eddac8025faf69cfaa4a750b171f392)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.ProbabilityMeasure | 1983 | 1985 | +2 (+0.10%) |
| Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.FiniteMeasure | 1941 | 1942 | +1 (+0.05%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.FiniteMeasure`|1|
| `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.DiracProba` `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.ProbabilityMeasure`|2|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ FiniteMeasure.measurable_prod`
`+ ProbabilityMeasure.measurable_prod`
`+ finite_measures_measurable_set`
`+ instance {α : Type*} [MeasurableSpace α] : MeasurableSpace (FiniteMeasure α)`
`+ instance {α : Type*} [MeasurableSpace α] : MeasurableSpace (ProbabilityMeasure α)`
`+ probability_measures_measurable_set`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Welcome!
You can see on this github page that some of the tests that are automatically run on any PR have failed. In this case "continuous integration / Build (push)" has failed. If you click on it, you'll get to a page with a list of errors.
In this case, they say that you have definitions that lack docstrings. Could you add docstrings to your definitions?

I am adding the awaiting-author label to indicate that the author of the PR needs to make modifications. Once the PR is ready for review again, you should remove that label.
@RemyDegenne Done!

Thank you for the comments, they are very useful :) You are right that the lemma generalizes to finite measures too, and I added that proof. 

In attempting to prove the generalization I incidentally proved that the set of finite measures and the set of probability measures are measurable sets in the giry monad (``finite_measures_measurable_set``, probability_measures_measurable_set``). They're not used in the main results, but do mathlib PR's typically keep these kinds of minor auxiliary results?

Here are some comments and suggestions.
You could also prove the same measurability theorem for `FiniteMeasure`, right?
This link does not work for me.
Updated
This instance is useful generally: it should not be local. Please remove `local` and move it to somewhere sensible in that file.

Here are several remarks and suggestions, and the resulting code at the bottom.
- first, I think the abbreviation is not that useful, and you should simply state a theorem about measurability of `fun (μ : ProbabilityMeasure α × ProbabilityMeasure β) ↦ (μ.1 : Measure α).prod (μ.2 : Measure β)`.
- the name of definitions should not be snake case but camel case: it would be `monoidalProduct` instead of `monoidal_product`.
- instead of using `Subtype.val`, you should use coercions: `(μ.1 : Measure α)`.
- if you don't use an abbrev the two local instances are not necessary and can be deleted
- the `rw` lines with `comp_def` are also not necessary
- we write `←` instead of `<-`
- if you use `simp_rw` instead of `rw`, you don't need to use `funext`
- you can use dot notation to write more concise proofs: see the two measurability proofs at the bottom.


```suggestion
/-- The monoidal product is a measurable function from the product of probability spaces over
``α`` and ``β`` into the type of probability spaces over ``α × β`` -/
theorem measurable_prod {α β : Type*} [MeasurableSpace α] [MeasurableSpace β] :
    Measurable (fun (μ : ProbabilityMeasure α × ProbabilityMeasure β)
      ↦ μ.1.toMeasure.prod μ.2.toMeasure) := by
  apply Measurable.measure_of_isPiSystem generateFrom_prod.symm isPiSystem_prod _ (by simp)
  simp only [mem_image2, mem_setOf_eq, forall_exists_index, and_imp]
  intros _ u Hu v Hv Heq
  simp_rw [← Heq, prod_prod]
  apply Measurable.mul
  · exact (measurable_coe Hu).comp (measurable_subtype_coe.comp measurable_fst)
  · exact (measurable_coe Hv).comp (measurable_subtype_coe.comp measurable_snd)
```

```suggestion
/-- The type of finite measures is a measurable space when equipped with the Giry monad. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The set of all finite measures is a measurable set in the Giry monad. -/
```

Two remarks about names:
- the definition for measurable sets is `MeasurableSet`, hence we use `measurableSet` in the lemma names (and not `measurable_set`). Same for `IsFiniteMeasure`.
- we put the property first: `measurableSet_isFiniteMeasure` and not `isFiniteMeasure_measurableSet`
```suggestion
lemma measurableSet_isFiniteMeasure {α : Type*} [MeasurableSpace α] :
```

```suggestion
lemma measurableSet_isProbabilityMeasure {α : Type*} [MeasurableSpace α] :
```

Single quotes for code in docstrings.
```suggestion
`α` and `β` into the type of probability spaces over `α × β`. Lemma 4.1 of
```

```suggestion
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aim.2020.107239. -/
```

In this proof, you are proving the same thing twice: once for the product of any two measurable sets, and once for univ x univ. Can you instead prove it once in a `have` subproof first, then use the result in both places?

There is a specialized corollary for probability measures that avoids the `(by simp)`:
```suggestion
  apply Measurable.measure_of_isPiSystem_of_isProbabilityMeasure generateFrom_prod.symm
    isPiSystem_prod _
```

```suggestion
/-- The monoidal product is a measurabule function from the product of finite measures over
`α` and `β` into the type of finite measures over `α × β`. -/
```
You should move that lemma to the file on `FiniteMeasure`.

pullRequest.title: feat: Giry monoidal product
